intro: Pleopeltis proteus, commonly known as the giant tree fern, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, feather-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant has a robust, unbranched trunk that stores water and nutrients, supporting its tall growth. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to the soil, while its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the fronds. This species plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
